title: Create the Gapminder dataset
text:
# Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd
from gapminder import gapminder

# Rename 'lifeExp' to 'life_expectancy' and 'gdpPercap' to 'gdp_per_capita'
gapminder = gapminder.rename(columns={'lifeExp': 'life_expectancy',
                                      'pop': 'population_millions', 
                                      'gdpPercap': 'gdp_per_capita'})

# Convert population to millions
gapminder['population_millions'] = gapminder['population_millions'] / 1_000_000

# Create a new pandas DataFrame from the modified gapminder data
gapminder_df = pd.DataFrame(gapminder)

# Save the DataFrame as a CSV file
gapminder_df.to_csv('gapminder.csv', index=False)

# Print the first 3 rows of the DataFrame
print(gapminder_df.head(3))

       country continent  year  life_expectancy  population_millions  \
0  Afghanistan      Asia  1952           28.801             8.425333   
1  Afghanistan      Asia  1957           30.332             9.240934   
2  Afghanistan      Asia  1962           31.997            10.267083   

   gdp_per_capita

title: ChristinaDai_Quiz02
text: The Gapminder dataset contains country-level data on life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population across time to study global development trends.

title: life-gdp.qmd
text:
Introduction
In this analysis, we will explore the relationship between life expectancy and GDP per capita using the Gapminder dataset. We will use python to analyze the data and visualize the results.


Data Loading

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np

# Load the Gapminder dataset
gapminder = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")



Graphing

plt.figure()
plt.scatter(
    gapminder["gdp_per_capita"],
    gapminder["life_expectancy"],
)

plt.xlabel("GDP per Capita")
plt.ylabel("Life Expectancy")
plt.title("Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita")

plt.show()

title: cambodia_analysis.qmd
text:
Introduction
In this analysis, we will analyze changes in life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population for Cambodia over time. We will use python to analyze the data and visualize the results.


Data Loading

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np

# Load the Gapminder dataset
gapminder = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")

# Filter the dataset for Cambodia
cambodia_data = gapminder[gapminder["country"] == "Cambodia"]



Graphing

# ---- Life Expectancy Over Time ----
plt.figure()
plt.plot(cambodia_data["year"], cambodia_data["life_expectancy"]) 
plt.xlabel("Year")
plt.ylabel("Life Expectancy (years)")
plt.title("Cambodia: Life Expectancy Over Time")
plt.show()









# ---- GDP per Capita Over Time ----
plt.figure()
plt.plot(cambodia_data["year"], cambodia_data["gdp_per_capita"])
plt.xlabel("Year")
plt.ylabel("GDP per Capita")
plt.title("Cambodia: GDP per Capita Over Time")
plt.show()









# ---- Population Over Time ----
plt.figure()
plt.plot(cambodia_data["year"], cambodia_data["population_millions"])
plt.xlabel("Year")
plt.ylabel("Population")
plt.title("Cambodia: Population Over Time")
plt.show()

title: life-population.qmd
text:
Introduction
In this analysis, we will explore the relationship between population size and life expectancy using the Gapminder dataset. We will use python to analyze the data and visualize the results.


Data Loading

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np

# Load the Gapminder dataset
gapminder = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")



Graphing

plt.figure()
plt.scatter(
    gapminder["population_millions"],
    gapminder["life_expectancy"],
)

plt.xlabel("Population (Millions)")
plt.ylabel("Life Expectancy")
plt.title("Life Expectancy and Population")

plt.show()
